title: Part a. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points

4 points: For each of the forces shown above with arrow correctly drawn and labeled, 1 point was awarded

For each incorrect or extraneous vector, such as acceleration or velocity, a point was deducted, with the minimum possible score being 0.

title: Part b. [02]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

∑ Fy = 0

1 point: For the correct y component of F1
N + F1sin θ – mg = 0

1 point: For the correct answer
N = mg – F1sin θ

title: Part b. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

∑ Fx = ma

1 point: For showing correct expressions for the horizontal forces and setting them equal to ma1
F1cos θ – µN = ma1

1 point: For substituting the expression for N from part b.
F1cos θ – µ(mg – F1sin θ) = ma1

1 point: For the correct answer

title: Part d. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For a linear relationship on the v versus t graph with positive slope and with v = 0 at t = 0

1 point: For a parabolic relationship on the x versus t graph that is concave upward, with

x = 0 at t = 0

1 point: For the two graphs being consistent with each other

title: Part e. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For indicating that N = 0 is the condition for the maximum acceleration of the block before it loses contact

1 point: For indicating that the friction force is zero
f=μN=0

∑ F x = F max cosθ=m a max

a max = F max cosθ m

Σ F y = F max sinθ−mg=0

F max = mg sinθ
Substituting Fmax into the expression for amax above
